original_table_html:
Analysis
Planning
Develop strategic plans

Develop marketing plans 		Implementation and Organization
Carry out the plans 		Control
Measure results
Evaluate results
Take corrective action
summary_markdown: This table outlines a three-phase management process: Planning, Implementation and Organization, and Control. The Planning phase involves the development of strategic and marketing plans. The subsequent Implementation and Organization phase focuses on executing these developed plans. Finally, the Control phase encompasses measuring and evaluating the results of the implemented plans, with the ultimate goal of taking corrective action. This structure represents a cyclical, process-based approach to management, where planning informs execution, and control mechanisms provide feedback for future planning.
